categories.name: Samurai Stories: Tales from Japanese History

questions.clue: This legendary samurai, known for his iconic duel on Ganryu Island in 1612, is often credited with developing the two-sword style.

In the late 12th century, this samurai leader established the first shogunate and became the de facto ruler of Japan.
The tale of the 47 ronin, samurai without a lord, is a famous story of loyalty and revenge culminating in an assault on this official's Edo home in 1703.
This 16th-century samurai who served under Nobunaga and Toyotomi is renowned for his abilities in both strategy and combat, later becoming the daimyo of Aizu.
